result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rafael Blas Jr

defendant.name: Blas, Rafael, Jr
defendant.address: 2805 South Chicago Avenue #102, South Milwaukee, WI 53172

records.addlTxt: As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.

Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 17, Judge Stark. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial.  Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 17.

Defendant Rafael Blas Jr in court.  Attorney Paige Aleece Styler in court for Rafael Blas Jr.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON SEPTEMBER 23rd, 2022.
Review hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Guilty plea and Addendum
Received and Filed.  guilty plea addendum
Received and Filed. Deferred Prosecution Agreement
